docs.title: TOGAF 10 Enterprise Architecture for Carbon-Aware Cloud Cost & Sustainability Optimization on Google Cloud
docs.text:
EU CSRD-compliant · Carbon-aware scheduling · FinOps + GreenOps unified

🚀 LAUNCH GREENOPS PLATFORM

This project showcases an Enterprise Architecture framework (based on TOGAF 10) for designing, implementing, and governing a cloud platform that prioritizes both Cost Efficiency (FinOps) and Environmental Sustainability (GreenOps).

Use the navigation panel on the left to explore the complete set of architectural artifacts, from business strategy and stakeholder requirements to detailed technology implementation.

Key Deliverables (Skills Demonstration): * Architecture Vision (Customer/Vision): Defining the need for FinOps/GreenOps alignment. * Business Architecture (Architecture/Business): Defining capabilities and value streams for sustainability and cost reduction. * Technology Architecture (Architecture/Technology): Designing the Carbon-Optimized GCP Landing Zone. * AI/ML Agents (Application/System Design): Leveraging Vertex AI and open-source LLMs for carbon forecasting and workload shifting.

docs.title: Vision: Problem Statement & Strategic Objectives
docs.text: This document establishes the strategic goals and core justification for the GreenOps Platform (TOGAF Phase A: Architecture Vision).

docs.title: 1. The Core Problem
docs.text:
Organizations face twin pressures: rising cloud infrastructure costs and increasing regulatory demands for sustainability reporting (e.g., EU CSRD, ESRS E1). Current cloud solutions typically treat FinOps (Cost) and GreenOps (Carbon) as separate, sometimes conflicting, initiatives, leading to wasted effort and unclear priorities.

The GreenOps Platform solves this by providing a unified architectural approach where cost and carbon optimization are inseparable design principles.

docs.title: 2. Strategic Objectives (The "Why")
docs.text:
The platform is designed to achieve the following business-critical outcomes:

Objective Business Goal Metric (KPI) Sustainability Compliance Achieve full EU CSRD (ESRS E1) reporting compliance. 100% Audit Readiness Cost Optimization Reduce non-essential compute and storage expenditure. 40% Cloud Cost Reduction Carbon Reduction Shift workloads to regions with high Carbon-Free Energy (CFE) sources. 30% Emissions Reduction (Scope 2/3) Operational Efficiency Automate deployment and monitoring of GreenOps strategies. 25% Quicker Initiative Adoption (SAFe)
